title: Git revert
mainDescription: It is one of the most safest commands out there.
Unlike rebase command which plays with the git history, the revert always creates a new commit object.
Consider the example below, if we want to revert the last commit, we would do git revert 66cc41f.
This would revert the changes and would be considered as a new commit. If any conflict is present we would have to resolve it.
postDescription: As you can see the head is now moved to 1be721c , which is the reversal commit.
